dad_jokes: When I was a kid, my mother told me I could be anyone I wanted to be. Turns out, identity theft is a crime.
What do sprinters eat before a race? Nothing, they fast!
Why couldn't the bicycle stand up by itself? It was two tired!
Did you hear about the restaurant on the moon? Great food, no atmosphere!
How many apples grow on a tree? All of them!
Why did the old man fall in the well? Because he couldn't see that well!
Want to hear a joke about construction? I'm still working on it!
Why do you never see elephants hiding in trees? Because they're so good at it!
What's orange and sounds like a parrot? A carrot!
What's brown and sticky? A stick!
What's a ninja's favorite type of shoes? Sneakers!
What do Santa's elves listen to ask they work? Wrap music!
Did you hear about the bacon cheeseburger who couldn't stop telling jokes? It was on a roll.
Why do vampires seem sick? They're always coffin.
Within minutes, the detectives knew what the murder weapon was. It was a brief case.
I used to work in a shoe-recycling shop. It was sole destroying!
I'm so good at sleeping I can do it with my eyes closed!
My uncle named his dogs Rolex and Timex. They're his watch dogs!
I invented a new word today: Plagiarism!

I wish you a productive morning.
I hope you have had a good rest and are ready for the day!

Good morning star shine. The earth says hello!

Did you know the city basically needed to be rebuilt following the great fire?
The best hot dog place no longer exists.. it was Demon Dogs up near DePaul.
Did you know that the airport code for O'hare is a reference to Orchard Field Airport?
My maker and the Sears Tower were both born in 1974
The first open-heart surgery was performed at Northwester University by Daniel Hale Williams
The Chicago River is the only river in the world that flows backwards. It empties into the Mississippi instead of Lake Michigan
The first time humans split at atom was at the University of Chicago on December 2, 1942 at 3:25 pm.
Chicago is roughly 234 square miles of land
Chicago is based on an Algonquin word meaning onion
There are 8 major professional sports teams in Chicago.. can you name them?
Route 66 does not end in Chicago... it actually begins there at the doorstep of the Art Institute
McCormick Place has enough available square footage of floor space to host all weekend NFL games simultaneously
The Adler Planetarium is the first planetarium in the Western Hemisphere (built by modern white people)
The L has been in service since 1892.
Softball was invented in Chicago. The first recorded game using the 16-inch ball took place in 1887 on Thanksgiving
The first gay rights oranization, the Society for Human Rights, was formed in Chicago in 1924.

vancouver: Vancouver is located in British Columbia, Canada.
It is one of the most ethnically diverse cities in Canada.
Vancouver is known for its natural beauty, surrounded by mountains and the Pacific Ocean.
The city was incorporated on April 6, 1886.
Vancouver is named after British Captain George Vancouver.
It has a population of over 675,000 people as of 2021.
Vancouver is the most densely populated city in Canada.
The Port of Vancouver is the largest port in Canada and the third-largest in North America.
Vancouver is home to Stanley Park, one of the largest urban parks in North America.
The city has hosted many international events, including the 2010 Winter Olympics.
Vancouver's public transportation system includes buses, SkyTrain, and SeaBus.
It is a popular filming location, often referred to as 'Hollywood North.'
Vancouver consistently ranks among the top five cities worldwide for livability and quality of life.
The city experiences a temperate oceanic climate with mild, rainy winters and warm, dry summers.
Vancouver is one of the warmest cities in Canada during winter.
Vancouver is a major hub for the video game development industry.
Vancouver has a rich cultural scene, including the Vancouver International Film Festival and the Vancouver Art Gallery.
Granville Island is a popular destination in Vancouver known for its public market, shops, and restaurants.
Vancouver has three major post-secondary institutions: University of British Columbia, Simon Fraser University, and Emily Carr University of Art + Design.
The Vancouver Aquarium is one of the city's major attractions.
Vancouver has a diverse culinary scene, known for its seafood and multicultural cuisine.
The city is known for its commitment to sustainability and green living.
Vancouver is often ranked as one of the most bike-friendly cities in North America.
English Bay Beach is one of Vancouver's most popular beaches.
Vancouver is home to the largest urban population of bald eagles in the world.
The Capilano Suspension Bridge is one of Vancouver's most famous landmarks.
Vancouver has one of the largest LGBTQ+ communities in Canada.
The Dr. Sun Yat-Sen Classical Chinese Garden is the first full-scale classical Chinese garden built outside China.
The Vancouver Public Library is one of the largest public library systems in Canada.
The Pacific National Exhibition (PNE) is an annual fair held in Vancouver since 1910.
Vancouver's Chinatown is one of the oldest and largest in North America.
Vancouver has a rich Indigenous history, with the Coast Salish peoples being the original inhabitants.
The Science World at Telus World of Science is a popular science museum in Vancouver.
Vancouver is home to one of the largest film festivals in North America, the Vancouver International Film Festival.
Gastown, Vancouver's oldest neighborhood, is known for its cobblestone streets and historic architecture.
The Vancouver Lookout offers panoramic views of the city from the top of the Harbour Centre.
